file_content.text: The Empire's clearing out fast. You did good.
Commander says this one's for all the marbles. Good luck in there.
Those Imperial contraptions aren't going to destroy themselves, you know.
I'm looking for Lem Karner.
You've found him. Good thing, too--now you can take this off my hands. It's the Barrager spike. Commander Madine sent it over.
Your job is to use that to take control of the Barrager. My job is to find it for you.
I guess there's been no word from Doctor Carsiri.
The doctor's still missing?
Not a peep. That's why you're dealing with an old tech like me.
You must be good.
It must be your job to fight these Imperials, too.
That doesn't seem fair.
Why do you think these soldiers are here? A sabacc tournament?
It takes a lot of power to destroy a fleet. I can trace where it's going and locate the Barrager that way.
But the Empire's got power-hungry contraptions all over this battlefield. As long as they're up, I can't get a clear reading. Get me?
Pretty much.
What are these contraptions?
Not even a little.
Signal jammers, security fields--wartime technology they're hoping will keep the Republic back.
You're the tech.
If Commander Madine ordered me to cross enemy lines, I'd be proud to die trying. But then I'd be, well, dead.
Empire's recalled their full forces here. Republic's doing all they can, but you've got a literal army to get through. Watch yourself.
Knock out everything the Empire's got running, hook this power monitor up to their primary sensor grid, and we'll find your weapon.
If the Empire advances, retreat. I'll figure things out.
Don't try to be a hero.
I was a front-lines tech in the Battle of Bothawui. This is nothing.
Comm me if this fight goes south. I'll be glad to help.
If you need backup....
Let's hope it doesn't come to that. The Empire's got a lot of tricks hiding in the Balmorran Arms Factory.
Any chance of a Republic escort or a distraction?
I don't like my odds.
If an attacking Republic army isn't a distraction, I don't know what is.
This won't take long.
I'd hate to get stuck behind enemy lines with nothing to show for it.
You'd better deliver.
You do your job, and I'll do mine.
As soon as I've got a lock on the Barrager's location, I'll comm you. Stay safe out there.
I'm a little busy right now. The battlefield's over there.
Don't try to be a hero.
Don't try to be a hero.
If you need backup....
If you need backup....
I don't like my odds.
I don't like my odds.
